body: Could you try run "mlflow.get_tracking_uri()" to get the tracking server uri ?

Do you mean to access the server outside of the "AzureML" ? I am not sure whether "AzureML" provides you the permission to do that, i.e., you need the permission to visit the node by a public hostname and the server port.

@manishpyy which client are you using? There are a few ways to fetch it:

1. Azure Portal UI
1.1. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16749003/164127325-a27074d4-2294-4353-b3a5-0976534f97c8.png)

2. V1 SDK: workspace_instance.get_mlflow_tracking_uri(): https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/python/api/azureml-core/azureml.core.workspace.workspace?view=azure-ml-py#azureml-core-workspace-workspace-get-mlflow-tracking-uri
3. V2 CLI (preview): https://github.com/Azure/azureml-examples/blob/main/cli/mlflow-uri.sh

And looking at an example URI, you can probably figure out how to template the values required:
azureml://**_eastus_**.api.azureml.ms/mlflow/v1.0/**_subscriptions/6560575d-fa06-4e7d-95fb-f962e74efd7a/resourceGroups/azureml-examples/providers/Microsoft.MachineLearningServices/workspaces/main_**

The uri I am getting is azureml://

I need a url starting with https:// to do a post/get request from outside the server, in the same way how we can get for databricks - https://adb-(workspace-id).azuredatabricks.net/

Sure, simply replace the azureml: scheme with https:. azureml is used to load our plugin, which handles authentication for you, so for Http you'll need to fetch a valid management.azure.com or ml.azure.com audience bearer token. Do you know how to do that?
Not aware of fetching the bearer token. Could you share any documentation for the same?

What type of identity are you trying to use to authenticate? As yourself in AAD or some managed identity/service principal?

EDIT: OH and which language are you trying to make these requests from?

Here is a complete service principal Auth flow in Java: https://github.com/Azure/azureml-examples/tree/main/cli/jobs/single-step/java/iris

The relevant Auth code is here: https://github.com/Azure/azureml-examples/blob/main/cli/jobs/single-step/java/iris/src/main/java/com/microsoft/aml/auth/AMLAuthentication.java

Note that this is just general AAD and applies to most resources, not just AML
And in general this area falls under Azure Identity, which publishes sdks in python, .NET, etc that simplify that process. Once you get the token, send it as a bearer token in every mlflow request

> What type of identity are you trying to use to authenticate? As yourself in AAD or some managed identity/service principal?
> 
> EDIT: OH and which language are you trying to make these requests from?

I'm using python. How do we obtain the bearer token in python for a managed identity/service principal

@manishpyy  I recommend getting started with this credential class: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/python/api/azure-identity/azure.identity.defaultazurecredential?view=azure-python

and [looking at the .get_token() method](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/python/api/azure-identity/azure.identity.defaultazurecredential?view=azure-python#azure-identity-defaultazurecredential-get-token) on it.

AzureML accepts scopes of "https://management.core.windows.net/" as shown above in the Java example.

This class will attempt either Managed Identity (usually served through a local endpoint MSI_ENDPOINT) or Service principal if you set the environment variables described in the first document automatically and pick the right one

@manishpyy we just added an example about [how to use the MLflow API in Azure ML in Python (Jupyter Notebook)](https://github.com/Azure/azureml-examples/blob/main/notebooks/using-mlflow/using-rest-api/using_mlflow_rest_api.ipynb).

Hi
I have set the tracking uri to the azure ml, since using it outside the azureml .Whenever I try these functions  log_artifacts(), download_artifacts() or list_artifacts() mlflow tracking client function. I get the following error:
mlflow.exceptions.MlflowException: Could not find a registered artifact repository for: azureml://experiments/test_experiment/runs/(run_number)/artifacts. Currently registered schemes are: ['', 'file', 's3', 'gs', 'wasbs', 'ftp', 'sftp', 'dbfs', 'hdfs', 'viewfs', 'runs', 'models', 'http', 'https', 'mlflow-artifacts']

How can I download/log the models/artifacts?

@manishpyy artifacts are more complicated as authentication and access to underlying storage come into play - please pip install the azureml-mlflow plugin (on pypi) which will handle that for you. @singankit fyi
